skin.name: Skin Redness
skin.description: Transforms an image to its redness form using local contrast enhancement method.  The input can be a PNG or a JPEG image, the output however, is always a PNG image. The redness algorithm is generic hence no specific device is targeted.
skin.model: The redness algorithm is trained over one thousand male skin images.
skin.performance:
(When service is idle)
CPU Usage: 0.03%
Memory Usage: 53.74MiB

Input Size - Response Time
8KB - 200ms
380KB - 1.8sec
2MB - 6.6sec

application.input: Bytes of an image in JPEG or PNG format.
application.output: Bytes of an image in PNG format.

skin.name: Redness Contours
skin.description: The redness contours algorithm calculates and displays the redness score of the shaving areas on a male face. The /rednesscontours/img endpoint returns a PNG image and /rednesscontours/values endpoint return scores as a JSON response.
skin.model: The redness contours algorithm uses the redness algorithm.
skin.performance:
(When service is idle)
CPU Usage: 0.04%
Memory Usage: 50MiB

Input Size - Response Time
300KB - 1.2sec

application.input: Bytes of an image in JPEG or PNG format.
application.output: Bytes of an image in PNG format.

skin.name: Face Skin Segmentation
skin.description: The face skin segmentation algorithm marks the forehead area of a given face image. The input can be a PNG or a JPEG image, the output however, is always a PNG image. Service can be accessed as /skinsegmentation/forehead to get an forehead image without semi-transparent mask overlay. The algorithm works on aligned images taken by a Visia device.
skin.model: The algorithm is based on deep learning (convolutional neural networks) and trained on 300K images (patches) taken by Visia.
skin.performance:
(When service is idle)
CPU Usage: 0.06%
Memory Usage: 1.553GiB

Input Size - Response Time
4MB - 3.5sec

application.input: Bytes of an image in JPEG or PNG format.
application.output: Bytes of an image in PNG format.

application.input: Bytes of an image in JPEG or PNG format.

skin.name: Face Skin Roughness
skin.description: The face skin roughness algorithm marks the forehead area of a given face image and then calculates the roughness score (1 to 100) on that area. The input can be a PNG or a JPEG image, the output is JSON with scores.
skin.model: The algorithm is based on deep learning (convolutional neural networks) and trained on 900K images.
skin.performance:
(When service is idle)
CPU Usage: 0.04%
Memory Usage: 146MiB

Input Size - Response Time
320KB - 3sec

application.input: Bytes of an image in JPEG or PNG format.
application.output: Bytes of an image in PNG format.

skin.name: Pimple Detection Service
skin.description: The pimple detetcion algorithm marks the pimples on a face image. The input can be a PNG or a JPEG image, the output however, is always a PNG image. Service can be accessed as /pimpledetection?mask=true to get only the mask image. Service can also be accessed as /pimpledetection/all to receive the overlay and the mask image in a single request as multi-part mime type.
skin.model: The algorithm is developed using Barista Active Learning Service.
skin.performance:
(When service is idle)
CPU Usage: 0.09%
Memory Usage: 60MiB

Input Size - Response Time
3MB - 5.3sec

application.input: Bytes of an image in JPEG or PNG format.
application.output: Bytes of an image in PNG format.

skin.name: Pores Detection Service
skin.description: The pores detetcion algorithm marks the pores on a face image. The input can be a PNG or a JPEG image, the output however, is always a PNG image. Service can be accessed as /poredetection?mask=true to get only the mask image. Service can also be accessed as /poredetection/all to receive the overlay and the mask image in a single request as multi-part mime type.
skin.model: The algorithm is developed using Barista Active Learning Service.

skin.name: Skin Oiliness
skin.description: Measures the oiliness level of skin. The algorithm performs SVM classification.
skin.performance:
(When service is idle)
CPU Usage: 0.05%
Memory Usage: 72.4MiB

Input Size - Response Time
15KB - 350ms
300KB - 370ms

application.input: Bytes of an image in JPEG or PNG format.
application.output: Oiliness Scores as a JSON Object.

skin.name: Skin Oiliness
skin.description: This algorithm classifies skin images in classes 'oily' or 'cleansed'.
skin.model:
The model is a convolutional neural network with 16 layers and 181922 model parameters. For training, a data set was split into 5 folds, 4 of which were used for training while the remaining fold was used for independent validation.

The run_id of this model is run_20180502-012034_geras_euny0q40
skin.performance: On the unseen validation data this model reaches an AUC-ROC score of 0.9857, a Cohenâ€™s Kappa score of 0.9, and an accuracy score of 0.95. Running times on GPU supported hardware are approximately 20 milliseconds, on CPU only hardware, running times for a single skin image are around 0.2 seconds.

application.input: Bytes of an image in JPEG or PNG format.
application.output: Oiliness Scores as a JSON Object.

body.name: Face Alignment
body.description: Produces a canonical alignment of a facial image based on translation, scale, and rotation.

application.input: Bytes of an image in JPEG or PNG format.
application.output: Bytes of an image in PNG format.

body.name: Face Geometry
body.description: Performs measurements on landmarks received from the face alignment service (eye width, face height, etc).

application.input: Bytes of an image in JPEG or PNG format.
application.output: Eye width, face height as JSON Object.

business.name: Skin Twin Recommendation
business.description:
The service is available at PGN: https://barista.research.philips.com:9007.
Please refer to the API documentation at: bitbucket/barista-netrec/

hair.name: Hair Segmentation
hair.description: The algorithm produces a segmentation of the hairs (in color green) present in the input image. If the service is called with the query parameter map=true, then the service returns only the segmented hair overlay image.
hair.model: The algorithm is based on deep learning (CNN UNet-128) and trained on 300 images taken by a very high resolution (2848, 4288, 3) Nikon camera.
hair.performance:
Mean absolute error: 0.0443
Accuracy: 0.9688

(When service is idle)
CPU Usage: 0.06%
Memory Usage: 112MiB

Input Size - Response Time
5MB - 16sec

application.input: Bytes of an image in JPEG or PNG format.
application.output: Bytes of an image in PNG format.
